newsitem.title: USA: Iomega to open N.C. distribution site.
newsitem.headline: Iomega to open N.C. distribution site.

text.p: Iomega Corp said on Friday it plans to open a North Carolina packaging and distribution facility, creating 300 jobs when it is operational in September.
Iomega plans to move the packaging and distribution facilities, currently in Roy, Utah, to the new facility in Greensboro by the fourth quarter of 1997.
This completes the manufacturing and distribution restructuring which began in late 1996 when Iomega shifted high-volume production to its new facility in Malaysia, Iomega said in a statement.

A majority of the current distribution employees in Roy affected by the move are under temporary employment contracts and have already found new employment opportunities inside and outside the company.
In December, the company announced that it would eliminate between 500 and 700 positions at its Roy facilities in production, manufacturing and distribution areas.

Roy remains the worldwide headquarters for Iomega and will continue to house research and development, strategic procurement, finance, sales and marketing as well as prototype development and production.
